<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/truncatedblake3">TruncatedBLAKE3&lt;NumBytes&gt;</a></>}>
Like <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blake3">BLAKE3</a></code> but using a class-level template parameter for specifying the hash size of the <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/truncatedblake3/#a74a099d51430f54417d27af6f552d183">final()</a></code> and <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/truncatedblake3/#adda4f5df8b748e9f3c27dc9872b52330">result()</a></code> functions. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/truncatedblake3/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The constant \\p LLVM&#95;BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN provides the default output length,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 32 bytes, which is recommended for most callers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Outputs shorter than the default length of 32 bytes (256 bits) provide</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// less security. An N-bit BLAKE3 output is intended to provide N bits of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// first and second preimage resistance and N/2 bits of collision</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// resistance, for any N up to 256 Longer outputs don&#39;t provide any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// additional security.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Shorter BLAKE3 outputs are prefixes of longer ones. Explicitly</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// requesting a short output is equivalent to truncating the default-length</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">/// output.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumBytes = LLVM&#95;BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a081d38a75bd71be1f6b2db493b46c70e"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a081d38a75bd71be1f6b2db493b46c70e">BLAKE3Result</a> = std::array&lt;uint8&#95;t, NumBytes&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Finalize the hasher and return an output of any length, given in bytes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This doesn&#39;t modify the hasher itself, and it&#39;s possible to finalize again</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// after adding more input.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/truncatedblake3/#a74a099d51430f54417d27af6f552d183"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a081d38a75bd71be1f6b2db493b46c70e">BLAKE3Result&lt;NumBytes&gt;</a> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">final</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">() &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blake3/#a1d9661e1a088c345ba2868f46caaf460">BLAKE3::final&lt;NumBytes&gt;</a>(); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return the current output for the digested data since the last call to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// init().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Other hash functions distinguish between \\p result() and \\p final(), with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\p result() allowing more calls into \\p update(), but there&#39;s no</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// difference for the BLAKE3 hash function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/truncatedblake3/#adda4f5df8b748e9f3c27dc9872b52330"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a081d38a75bd71be1f6b2db493b46c70e">BLAKE3Result&lt;NumBytes&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/truncatedblake3/#adda4f5df8b748e9f3c27dc9872b52330">result</a>() &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blake3/#ab6da7d121372343d7fced230ad454f18">BLAKE3::result&lt;NumBytes&gt;</a>(); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
